Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Class AbstractDataOutboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractOutboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractDataOutboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentInterface, DataRequiredCI.PullCI, DataRequiredCI.PushCI, OfferedCI, RequiredCI, DataOutboundPortI, OutboundPortI, PortI, Serializable, Remote
    public abstract class AbstractDataOutboundPort
extends AbstractOutboundPort
implements DataOutboundPortI
    The class AbstractDataOutboundPort partially implements an outbound port for data exchanging components.

    Description

    Data exchanging components focus their interaction on the exchange of pieces of data rather than calling each others services. Hence, the required and offered interfaces merely implements a simple protocol in terms of methods used to pass data from the provider to the clients. But data exchanges can be done in two modes: pull (the primary one) and push. For outbound port, representing interfaces through which a client calls the provider, the port uses the required pull interface, that is also implemented by the connector, while the port implements the required push interface through which data can be received in push mode from the provider.

    A concrete outbound connector must therefore implement the method receive which will receive a piece of data as parameter and pass it to the owner component.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      update the index of the executor service that this inbound port must use in its owner after a change in the latter.

      • AbstractDataOutboundPort

        public AbstractDataOutboundPort​(String uri,
                                Class<? extends DataRequiredCI.PullCI> implementedPullInterface,
                                Class<? extends DataRequiredCI.PushCI> implementedPushInterface,
                                ComponentI owner,
                                String pluginURI,
                                String executorServiceURI)
                         throws Exception
        create and initialize a data outbound port.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null and owner != null
 pre    implementedPullInterface != null
 pre    implementedPushInterface != null
 pre    pluginURI == null || owner.isInstalled(pluginURI)
 pre    executorServiceURI == null || owner.validExecutorServiceURI(executorServiceURI)
 post   getPortURI().equals(uri)
 post   getOwner().equals(owner)
 post   !connected()
 post !isRemotelyConnected()
 post   owner.isPortExisting(uri)
 post   getImplementedInterface().equals(implementedPullInterface)
 post   getImplementedPushInterface().equals(implementedPushInterface)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the port.
        implementedPullInterface - pull interface implemented by this port.
        implementedPushInterface - push interface implemented by this port.
        owner - component that owns this port.
        pluginURI - URI of the plug-in to be called in the owner or null if none.
        executorServiceURI - URI of the executor service to be used to execute the service on the component or null if none.
        Throws:
        Exception - todo.
